low.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: small, or smaller than usual, in amount, level, or value
low.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: In May, the price of cocoa fell to its lowest level since 1975–76.
Morale has been low since the latest round of job cuts.
In this sort of investment, the risks are fairly low.
families existing on very low incomes
low.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: having less than the usual amount of a substance or chemical
low.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: food that is low in calories
low.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: if a number, temperature, or level is in the low 20s, 30s etc, it is between 21 and 23,31 and 33 etc
low.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Tonight, temperatures in most areas will be in the low 50s.
low.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: having a top that is not far above the ground
low.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: at a point that is not far above the ground or near the bottom of something
low.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: The sun was low in the sky now.
Store raw meat on the lowest shelf.
low.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: The river is very low today.
low.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: bad, or below an acceptable or usual level or quality
low.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: Their safety standards seem to be pretty low.
Cost-cutting has led to a lower quality of service.
the children’s low achievement in school
low.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: if you are low on something, or if your supply of something is low, there is not much of it left
low.translation[0].definitions[8].exampl: I heard a low moaning noise.
The volume is too low – turn it up.
low.translation[0].definitions[10].defin: a light that is low is not bright
low.translation[0].definitions[10].examp: Use low lighting to give the room a romantic atmosphere.
low.translation[0].definitions[11].defin: if you cook something over a low heat or in a low oven, you cook it using only a small amount of heat
low.translation[0].definitions[12].defin: a battery that is low does not have much power left in it
low.translation[0].definitions[13].defin: a low dress, blouse etc does not cover your neck and the top of your chest
low.translation[0].definitions[14].defin: unhappy and without much hope for the future
low.translation[0].definitions[14].examp: He was feeling a bit low, so I did my best to cheer him up.
Terry seems to be in rather low spirits today.
low.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: a low voice or sound is not high on the scale of musical sounds
I can’t sing the low notes.
He’s got quite a low singing voice.
Boys’ voices usually become much lower as they get older.
a deep voice or sound is low, strong, and pleasant
He has a lovely deep voice.
The engine has a wonderfully deep sound to it, like it’s ready to race.
a husky  voice is deep, quiet, and rough-sounding, especially in a way that is attractive
Monroe sang 'Happy Birthday, Mr President’ in a slow husky voice.
His voice dropped to a husky whisper.
a gravelly voice is very low and rough sounding
The singer is famous for his gravelly voice.
low.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: in or to a low position or level
low.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: He bent low over the engine.
She pulled her hat low down over her eyes.
I had the radio on low.
low.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: near the ground or the bottom of something
low.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: There was a hole low down in the hedge.
low.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: if you play or sing musical notes low, you play or sing them with deep notes
low.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: Sing those bars an octave lower.
low.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a low price, level, or value
low.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: Public confidence in the legal system is at an all-time low (=much lower or worse than ever before).
The euro has fallen to a new low against the dollar.
fall to/hit/reach etc a new low
low.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: a very difficult time in someone’s personal or working life
low.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: the highs and lows of an actor’s life
low.translation[2].definitions[2].defini: the lowest point that the temperature reaches during a particular time
low.translation[2].definitions[3].defini: an area of low pressure in the air
low.translation[2].definitions[3].exampl: a low moving in over the Pacific
low.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: if cattle low, they make a deep sound
low.translation[4].definitions[0].defini: small, or smaller than usual, in amount, level, or degree
low.translation[4].definitions[0].exampl: City analysts have said the takeover offer is too low.
It is vital to keep your overhead costs as low as possible.
a mortgage at a low rate of interest
low.translation[4].definitions[1].defini: below an acceptable standard or quality
low.translation[4].definitions[1].exampl: Safety standards in the industry are much too low.
Cost-cutting has led to a lower quality of service.
low.translation[4].definitions[2].defini: a supply of something that is low is nearly finished
low.translation[5].definitions[0].exampl: Its shares fell to a low of 550p.
Inflation is heading for an all-time low.
